result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan L. Nance was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County/Municipality [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jordan L. Nance in court.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III in court for Jordan L. Nance.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard. Moving to amend to an ordinance. State recommends a $100.00 forfeiture plus costs. 
Atty Stroud is heard and confirms the agreement. 

Defendant plead not guilty. 
Court accepts the no contest plea and finds defendant guilty. 

Court accepts the amended charge. $263.50 plus the witness charge of $67.00 = $330.50. Bond to be applied. The total after the $150.00 bond applied  will be $180.50. 60DTP.

1:50 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jordan L. Nance appeared by phone.  Attorney Donald Ritchey Stroud III appeared by video for Jordan L. Nance.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Stroud is heard on status.  Requests a plea and sentencing.
